structure.unit: Inland Fisheries And Game And Other Natural Resources

text.section: Deer and bear: three hundred dollars per animal illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Wild turkey, fisher, bobcat and otter: two hundred dollars per animal illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Fox, coyote and beaver: fifty dollars per animal illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Mink, muskrat, raccoon, wild rabbit, hare and gray squirrel: twenty-five dollars per animal illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Ruffed grouse, pheasant, quail, woodcock and migratory waterfowl: twenty-five dollars per bird illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Fish: five dollars per fish illegally taken or illegally possessed.
Endangered, Threatened and Special Concern Species included on the official Massachusetts List of Endangered Wildlife and Wild Plants established pursuant to section 4 of chapter 131A.
Other animals or birds: ten dollars per animal or bird.
